description.raw:
Image Viewer does not display correctly grayscale images ("L_INT8"). They appear as random black and white pixels.
This is because the image data is copied into a QImage with format QImage::Format_Mono which has 1 bit per pixel.

This PR:
- fixes the format to use QImage::Format_Grayscale. 
- removes the L_INT16 case because there is no 16bits QImage format and that would lead to corrupted copy. 
- checks for changes in image format to reinit the qimage object
description.html:
Image Viewer does not display correctly grayscale images ("L_INT8"). They appear as random black and white pixels. This is because the image data is copied into a QImage with format QImage::Format_Mono which has 1 bit per pixel.

This PR: - fixes the format to use QImage::Format_Grayscale. - removes the L_INT16 case because there is no 16bits QImage format and that would lead to corrupted copy. - checks for changes in image format to reinit the qimage object

title.raw: Image Viewer: fix QImage::Format used to display grayscale images
title.html: Image Viewer: fix QImage::Format used to display grayscale images
